source.title: Functional-Anatomic Fractionation of the Brain's Default Network

confidence_rationale: Subsystem-level DMN evidence supports distinct reflective functions compatible with controlled replay structures.

mapping.source_claim_statement: The default network comprises functionally distinct subsystems rather than a unitary network function.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-029 by motivating separate reflective replay components and guarded integration paths.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Network fractionation alone does not imply specific policy for hypothesis tagging vs commitment.
mapping.source_context: Resting-state and task-related functional-anatomic DMN partitioning analysis.

confidence_components.notes: Good architectural evidence for differentiated reflective processing.
